page.title: 01LANDSCAPE,GOBOWEN & DISTRICT
page.content: Lying to the east of the{Berwyn {Hills}this area is mainly undulating land with two small rivers flowing eastwards.These are the Morlass Brook and the River Perry.{North Shropshire meets the Welsh Uplands. Running north to south are remnants of {Watt's Dyke}an ancient boundary between Wales and England.The{A5 {London to Holyhead road}along with the {Shrewsbury to Chester railway line also align themselves with the dyke. In the north west corner the {Shropshire Union Canal (Llangollen {Branch)}crosses the dyke's path. { Gobowen, Weston Rhyn and Hengoed}are the three main settlements.There are two church parishes meeting here, Hengoed Cwm Gobowen and St.Martin's.
